{"step_by_step_thinking": "Kwashiorkor is a form of severe protein malnutrition characterized by edema, and an enlarged liver with fatty infiltrates. It usually occurs in children after weaning from breast milk and is due to insufficient protein intake despite sufficient calorie intake, which aligns with option A. It typically affects children between the ages of 6 months and 3 years, which aligns with option B. In Kwashiorkor, subcutaneous fat is preserved, but there is atrophy of different tissues, which aligns with option C. Therefore, all of the statements are true about Kwashiorkor.", "answer_choice": "D"}
